com.conceptwave.scripting
Class ProcessActivity

com.conceptwave.scripting.Object
  com.conceptwave.scripting.CWScriptable
      com.conceptwave.scripting.ProcessActivity

public class ProcessActivity
extends CWScriptable

Process activity object. Activities are stored in the database as well as in the memory cache.

 com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer Status
          READONLY: Returns the state(status) of the current activity 0 - activity did not start 1 - selected - PE started to work with this activity 2 - activity is waiting for message 3 - activity is waiting for completion of all its children 4 - activity is completed states 8, 9 and 10 are states 1,2 and 3 respectively but they are currently suspended

Field Detail

Status

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer Status
READONLY: Returns the state(status) of the current activity 0 - activity did not start 1 - selected - PE started to work with this activity 2 - activity is waiting for message 3 - activity is waiting for completion of all its children 4 - activity is completed states 8, 9 and 10 are states 1,2 and 3 respectively but they are currently suspended

activityData

public CwObject activityData
READONLY: Returns the data object send to the interface or received from the interface by this activity. If the activity is not participant operation the data is null.

document

public CwObject document
READONLY: Activity data. For example: The data object received by operation activity.

endTime

public Date endTime
READONLY: Process activity completion time, null if activity didn’t complete.

executedActivity

public ProcessActivity executedActivity
READONLY: Returns the last executed activity. When used in 'after' script of a complex activity like switch or choice activity this property contains the child activity that was executed last by the complex activity and which completion causes the completion of the complex activity executing the script. Otherwise it will return the previously executed activity. Note that if used in the scripts of the first activity of the process it will return null. If used in global process that has repeat loop including the first activity it will return null only on the first iteration but not on the following iterations.

index

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer index
READONLY: Process activity index (see _getActivityByIndex function of a Process object).

isCompleted

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isCompleted
READONLY: The activity completion status.

isRunning

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isRunning
READONLY: Gets the execution status of the activity. Returns true if the activity is currently executing or is selected to be executed or is waiting on participant operation. Complex activities that wait for children to be completed are considered too to be "running"

label

public String label
READONLY: Gets the activity label in the default language

name

public String name
READONLY: Returns activity name.

parent

public ProcessActivity parent
READONLY: Returns the partent activity or null if the current activity is the top activity.

path

public String path
READONLY: Returns activity path. The activity parent names are separated by slash.

process

public Process process
READONLY: Returns the process to which this activity belongs.

root

public ProcessActivity root
READONLY: Returns root parent of this activity. If this activity is part of subflow, returns subflow, otherwise returns top activity.

startTime

public Date startTime
READONLY: Process activity execution start time, null if activity hasn’t start.

Constructor Detail

ProcessActivity

public ProcessActivity()
Method Detail

delayMessageToProcess

public void delayMessageToProcess(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object dTime,
                                  com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer priority)
Changes priority/ earliest consume time of the current message. Method can be called from the After Script of the Operation activity only and applies to the message processed by the current Operation. Calls outside of the After Script of the Operation activity cause exception.

Parameters:
dTime - Optional delay time indicating the earliest time when this message can be consumed. It can either be a timestamp (java.util.Date) indicating absolute time or an integer specifying the relative delay (in seconds) from the current moment. Timestamp must be in future. Relative delay cannot exceed 6 months (190 days). If parameter is null or 0, earliest consume time property of the message stays unmodified.
priority - Optional message priority in the range from 0 to 15, where 1 is the highest priority and 15 is the lowest priority. If parameter is null or 0, priority of the message stays unmodified. Value out of range causes exception.

getActivityByPath

public ProcessActivity getActivityByPath(String path)
Returns child activity for the given activity path.

Parameters:
path - Child activity path. Activity path is a string of the names of all parent activities of the required activity up to, but not including, the current activity. The activity names in the path are separated by slash character (‘/’ character). Examples: "case1" – gets activity with name case1 that is the immediate child of the current activity; "case1/seq1/operation1" - get activity operation1 which is child of activity seq1 which is child of activity case 1 which is child of the current activity.
Returns:
The activity or null if the requested activity does not exist in the metadata process.

raiseProcessException

public void raiseProcessException(String exception,
                                  CwObject data)
Raises exception for the specified activity. The exception will be processed after the current activity is processed. If there are more than one raised exceptions they will be processed in the order they have been raised.

Parameters:
exception - The fully qualified metadata exception name
data - An optional data object for the exception. Must be document, order or data structure

repeatCount

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer repeatCount()
Returns the repeat count of this activity (how many times the activity has been performed from the beginning of the process).

Returns:
The activity repeat count
